field_reports.description: On the evening of 16/7/2025, a fire occurred in a 6-storey building used as a hypermarket in the Corniche area of the city of Al-Kut, and this fire led to the complete burning of the building and caused great human and material losses.

field_reports.description:
Since Wednesday morning, in 1, May,2024, heavy rains fell on the provinces of Iraq in varying amounts over two days, resulting in human and material damages as detailed below:

  1. Diyala: The regions of Kishkool and Al-Salam were affected by rain floods, causing damage to 86 families, equivalent to 516 individuals.
  2. Maysan: 14 families were affected by floods, totaling 84 individuals. The total number of flood-affected families in Iraq is 100, equivalent to 600 individuals.

results.name: IRQ: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 05-2024 - cyclone cody
results.summary:
Since the morning of Wednesday, May 1, 2024, heavy rains have fallen on the governorates of Iraq in varying quantities over two days, resulting in human and material losses as detailed below:

  1. Diyala: Kashkool and Al-Salam areas were affected by torrential rains, which caused damage to 86 families, equivalent to 516 individuals.
  2. Maysan: 14 families were affected by the floods, totaling 84 individuals. The total number of flood-affected households in Iraq is 100, equivalent to 600 individuals.

contacts.name: Abdul Basit Khan SWATI
contacts.title: Manager, Programmes and Operations- IFRC, Iraq Delegation

field_reports.description: On the morning of April 15, 2024, rain started falling differently in the provinces of Iraq. The rain fell rapidly and heavily in Erbil Province, leading to floods in areas such as Kalkand, Terao, Dara Tu, and Birzin. This resulted in damage to the homes of 144 families, affecting a total of 864 individuals due to these floods.

contacts.name: Abdul Basit Khan SWATI
contacts.title: Manager, Programmes and Operations- IFRC, Iraq Delegation,

field_reports.description: Updates On the afternoon of 19th March 2024, heavy rain began falling across all provinces of Iraq, varying in amounts. Some provinces were affected by the rain, leading to floods, such as Erbil where 86 families, equivalent to 516 individuals, were affected by the floods in areas (Terawa, Badawa, Koistan, Dara To). Dohuk was affected due to its proximity to neighbouring Turkey from floods, torrents, and increasing damages that turned into human and material losses. More than 1240 houses were damaged, 138 cars destroyed, 3 people lost their lives, and 11 others were injured. A total of 950 families were evacuated and accommodated in mosques, schools, and some in hotels and 290 families stayed with their relatives. The affected areas were mostly in Dohuk province (Broushki, Nzarki, Atiti, Naoura, Mahalla Shili, Hay Al-Jazma, Hay Al-Shurta, Al-Ulya, Kzabra, Mahalla Kulli), in addition to the district of Zakho. The floods and torrents also damaged pavements and roads, with a total of 1240 families affected by this disaster, equivalent to 7440 individuals divided among 850 families, equivalent to 5100 individuals distributed across most areas and districts of Dohuk, and 390 families, equivalent to 2340 individuals distributed in the district of Zakho near the Turkish borders. As for the provinces of Diyala and Maysan due to their proximity to neighbouring Iran, they witnessed floods in addition to the rain, resulting in minimal material losses due to the flooding on the outskirts of Diyala province (areas of Baladrooz, Al-Muqdadiyah) where only two families, equivalent to 12 individuals, were affected. In Maysan, the flow of torrents continued on the outskirts of the province in rural areas, and today on 20th March 2024, the weather is clear. However, weather forecasts predict a resumption of rain on Sunday, 24th March 2024, leading to additional floods in the Kurdistan region and most provinces of Iraq according to the Iraqi Meteorological Organization.
field_reports.summary: IRQ: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 03-2024 - flooding and flood-update#1

contacts.name: Abdul Basit Khan SWATI
contacts.title: Manager, Programmes and Operations- IFRC, Iraq Delegation

field_reports.description: On the afternoon of 19th March 2024, heavy rain began to fall across all provinces of Iraq in varying amounts. Some provinces were affected by the rain, leading to floods, such as Erbil where 86 families, equivalent to 516 individuals, were affected by floods in areas like Terawa, Badawa, Koyistan, and Dara Tow. Dohuk was affected due to its proximity to neighbouring Turkey, facing floods, torrents, and escalating damages resulting in human and material losses. 160 houses were damaged, 50 cars were destroyed, 3 people died, and 11 others were injured. A total of 627 people were evacuated and accommodated in mosques, schools, and some in hotels. The affected areas in most parts of Dohuk province included Baroshki, Nazarki, Atiti, Naoura, Mahalla Sheli, Hay Al-Jazma, Hay Al-Shurta, Al-Ulya, Kizabra, and Mahalla Kuli. The floods and torrents also caused damage to pavements and roads. As for the provinces of Diyala and Maysan due to their proximity to neighbouring Iran, they also witnessed floods in addition to the rain, resulting in minor material losses due to the flow of floods on the outskirts of Diyala province (areas of Baldrouz, Al-Muqdadiyah) where only two families, equivalent to 12 individuals, were affected. In Maysan, the torrents continued to flow on the outskirts of the province in rural areas, and today on 20th March 2024, the weather is clear. However, weather forecasts predict a resumption of rain, leading to additional floods tomorrow, Thursday, 21st March 2024, in the Kurdistan region.
field_reports.summary: IRQ: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 03-2024 - Flooding and Floods

field_reports.description:
Due to the seasonal rains that fell on 15-16/2/2024, floods and torrents occurred in several scattered areas of the provinces (Erbil, Sulaymaniyah, Wasit, Diyala), resulting in material losses as detailed below:             

 
1 )Alsulimania/ On 15-16 February, 2024, floods occurred (Kfri District - Kalar District), and the number of affected families was 200 families the equivalent of 1,200. Streets, sidewalks, infrastructure, water and sewage sewers were damaged, and damage was caused to some poultry fields and agricultural greenhouses.

2 ) Erbil / On 15-16 February, 2024, floods occurred in the areas of (Tairawa - Kalakand - Koysanjak District - Soran District), where 114 families That is equivalent to 684 people were affected by rainwater entering homes and damaging home furniture. 
3 ) Diyala / On 15-16 February, 2024, floods and storms occurred in the village of Al-Badwaniyah and the village of Al-Mujaddid in the Al-Khalis District, and floods in the Khanaqin District, where 175 families, equivalent to 1,050 people, were affected.

results.name: IRQ: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 02-2024 - CYCLONE CODY

contacts.title: Disaster Risk Management Delegate in iraq

field_reports.description: Cholera has become a threat in Iraq, where the first confirmed case was recorded on 15/6/2022. The spread began in Sulaymaniyah Governorate, and the environment was ripe for its spread, as there was pollution in the main water tanks, which helped spread and people were ignorant of its symptoms, and then Erbil and Kirkuk and suspected cases of unconfirmed cases in Basra. And Muthanna, as hospitals in Iraq are not prepared to deal with this disease, as confirmed cases in all of Iraq recorded 100 cases of cholera
field_reports.summary: IRQ: Other - 2022-06 -24 The response of the Iraqi Red Crescent Society to the outbreak of cholera

results.name: IRQ: Other - 2022-06 - The response of the Iraqi Red Crescent Society to the outbreak of cholera
results.summary: A cholera outbreak in Iraq has infected hundreds of people, and records of more suspected cases have been sent for lab testing in the central laboratory in Baghdad, most of which are from the northern Kurdistan region. As announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) officials in Baghdad, there has been a recent spike in hospitalization following diarrhea cases in Sulaymaniyah, Erbil, Duhok, and southern governorates of Iraq. The KRI Mnistry of Health, published a statement on Thursday 23 June 2022, and issued a directive in regard to dealing with the diarrheal outbreak in the region. The increase in Cholera cases in Sulaymaniyah and other governorates is a reason for concern for the MoH, as it is coming on the backdrop of the COVID-19 pandemic and other epidemic-prone outbreaks. However, the Ministry of Health both in Baghdad and in the Kurdistan region is ready to prepare for and respond to this outbreak and lessen the impact on the affected population. The MoH has also requested that the in-country humanitarian actors support government efforts to deal with this outbreak.

field_reports.description:
Due to the seasonal rains that fell on 15-16/2/2024, floods and torrents occurred in several scattered areas of the provinces (Erbil, Sulaymaniyah, Wasit, Diyala), resulting in material losses as detailed below: 
1 ) Sulaymaniyah - (Floods occurred in the districts of Koifri and Klar, damaging streets, sidewalks, and infrastructure of the mentioned cities above, affecting 200 houses due to rainwater entering these homes). 
2 ) Erbil - (Floods occurred in Terao, Kalkand, Dara To, Koysinjaq district, Suran district, where 114 families were affected by rainwater entering homes and damaging household furniture). 
3 ) Diyala - (Floods and storms occurred in the villages of Al-Badawaniya and Al-Majid village in the Khales district, affecting 80 families due to the storm).

field_reports.description: Heavy rains began to fall in Erbil governorate since dawn on January 13, 2022, and due to the weak sources of water drainage, which led to the sinking of several areas in Erbil, such as (Zaylan City - Tirawa - Kalkind - Si Bardan - Berzin - Shawish - Erbil Jdeideh - Zirin - Kart Jotiar-Nusran-Brai T), which led to the damage of 2,238 houses due to rain water entering the houses, but fortunately there are no casualties and this is the third time that Erbil Governorate has been flooded as a result of rain
field_reports.summary: IRAQ/Flash Flood -reponse IRCS in Erbil Update,#c(2022-01-13)

field_reports.description: On 12/17/2021, and at exactly 4:00 am, heavy rain suddenly began, which led to heavy, destructive and fast-flowing rains in Erbil Governorate in the areas (Dar Tu, Qushtep, Xi'an, Roshanberi, Mamustian) and these torrents left losses humankind, killing 11 of them. A 10-month-old girl drowned and is being searched for, 40 people were injured and 1,000 families were injured by this disaster, the equivalent of 6000 people. The initial situation is now, and after one day has passed and the weather conditions have stabilized, the outcome has begun to change, as the number of wounded has reached 55 people and 14 people have died, and this outcome is until December 19, 2020, according to the official source of Erbil Governorate.
field_reports.summary: IRAQ/FLASH FLOOD-Update( A ) report Response IRCS in Erbil2021-12-17

field_reports.description: At 2:00 p.m. on Saturday, 10/30/2021, rain began to fall heavily in Erbil governorate for only one hour, and because of the heavy rains, it sank and swept away the floods in the areas on the outskirts of Erbil, such as (Baherka - Mulla Omar - Koreya Village - and Zilan City Kart Jotiar). Where people were evacuated by government helicopters for people to climb to the roofs of houses and because of the high water level and its transformation into torrential torrents, 530 families were rescued, or approximately 3180 and lost two children who are being searched for, and several families, approximately 10 families, were displaced to other areas, and the rest of the families remained With their relatives until their role is rehabilitated...

field_reports.description: A fire broke out in the second-hand clothing and perfume market located in the Abu Dsheer area in the south of Baghdad governorate on June 11, 2022, burning more than 225 booths built of highly flammable sandwich panels. 50 firefighting teams participated in extinguishing the fire.

The city of Nasiriyah yesterday has witnessed a horrific fire incident that broke out at Al-Naqa Center in Al-Hussein Hospital, which is designated to isolate those infected with Covid (19), that took the lives of (62) of the patients, and 22 bodies of them are still unknown because they were charred. More than (100) patients, escorts, and medical staff working in the above-mentioned center were injured in the fire, immediately after the accident, the volunteers of the Iraqi Red Crescent Most of the hospital is built of sandwich panels because it was built in an emergency for sanitary isolation
field_reports.summary: UPDATE Response IRCS /The Fire of Al-Naqa Center in Nasiriyah governorate #1

results.name: UPDATE Response IRCS /The Fire of Al-Naqa Center in Nasiriyah governorate #1

field_reports.description: Al-Waheilat market is located in Sadr City, east of Baghdad, visited by thousands of poor families on the eve of the blessed Eid al-Adha for shopping, especially children’s clothes. Therefore, the market was crowded with Iraqi families with their children at the moment they were targeted by a suicide bomber who blew himself up in the midst of these people, which led to the death of 35 people and the wounding of more than 60 people, most of them children, according to the Iraqi Ministry of Health statistics.
field_reports.summary: The Response of the Iraqi Red Crescent Society to the explosion of Al-Wahaila market in Sadr City

results.name: The Response of the Iraqi Red Crescent Society to the explosion of Al-Wahaila market in Sadr City

field_reports.description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.3 occurred shortly ago in the Elam area within Iranian territory and specifically near the Iraqi-Iranian border near Wasit province, and the epicenter of the quake is about 10 km in depth. There is no human or material damage.

Charia camp is located in Dohuk provinces and is inhabited by displaced people from the Yazidi community after they attacked their cities ISIS in Nineveh province in 2014 and killed many of them 
An unidentified fire broke out in Charia camp and 377 tents were set on fire, affecting 990 people and accelerating the Kurdistan Civil Defense Directorate to evacuate survivors and extinguish the fire.

Ibn Al-Khatib Hospital: It is located at the meeting point of the Diyala River and the Tigris River, and this area is open agricultural. The hospital receives cases of communicable and endemic diseases such as measles, smallpox, typhoid, cholera, pandemic influenza, viral hepatitis, Malta fever and undiagnosed fever. The hospital was established in 1962 and was a wing of the armed forces for communicable diseases, and then transferred to the Ministry of Health.
And due to the spread of the Corona pandemic, it has become special for treating people with the Corona pandemic
The disaster occurred after the explosion of oxygen cylinders inside the recovery hall at night from 4/24/2021 and the source pointed out that ambulances rushed to the hospital to transport the burn victims and the bodies to Baghdad hospitals, from which 45 bodies were transferred to Al-Zafaraniya Hospital in the early hours of the event
At least 82 people were killed and 110 others injured when a fire broke out in a hospital designated to treat patients with Covid-19 in the Iraqi capital, Baghdad, according to the Ministry of Interior.
It was reported that the explosion of an oxygen cylinder in the intensive care unit, in which patients connected to breathing machines and unable to move, were what led to the outbreak of the fire.

According to emergency service officials, many died in Ibn Al-Khatib Hospital due to being disconnected from the source of oxygen, while others suffocated from smoke.

People were looking for relatives in the charred hospital wards. Witnesses said people were jumping out of the windows to escape from the flames.
On the date of 4/15/2021, coincidentally, Thursday, a car bomb exploded in Sadr City near a market for used materials, which the poor go to shop from, which is the Al-Orfaly Market. The explosion

At 6:15 p.m. on 6 April 2021, on Tuesday, Sulaimaniyah province, specifically at The Benguen district, was hit by an earthquake nearby on the Iranian border with a magnitude of 5.3 on the Richter scale, and there was no human and material damage, as the buildings were slightly damaged and 15 people were slightly injured.

A bakery oven in the Diwaniyah governorate in the eastern Hamza district, a gas leak occurred in it, which led to the explosion of the bakery, injuring more than 30 wounded and the death of one person, and more than 60 families were affected directly and indirectly.

The Iraqi Red Crescent Society developed a plan to provide psychological support to the wounded and martyrs due to the trauma they have gone through, to provide home first aid to the wounded, and to provide a financial grant to the injured and families of martyrs to overcome the economic crisis
